intro: Yunckeria, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are characterized by their evergreen leaves and showy, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Yunckeria species typically grow in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
